title: Real Action for Nature Restoration and Environmental Education through Ecoriparian Development at UMRI and UNILAK
text:

Minister of Environment and Forestry Siti Nurbaya inaugurated two important projects in the field of environmental restoration, namely Ecoriparian Muhammadiyah University of Riau (UMRI) and UNILAK on Monday (30/9/2024). Photo: KLHK Public Relations
jpnn.com JAKARTA – The Ministry of Environment and Forestry (KLHK) inaugurated two important projects in the field of environmental restoration, namely Ecoriparian Muhammadiyah University of Riau (UMRI) and Lancang Kuning University (UNILAK) on Monday (30/9/2024).
This project aims to restore water quality and maintain ecosystem balance while providing environmental education facilities to the local community.
Both eco-divisions were built in collaboration with the business world, namely PT Pertamina Hulu Rokan (PHR).
Ecoriparian UMRI will begin construction in 2023, equipped with a domestic wastewater treatment plant (IPAL) that processes wastewater with a capacity of 13,200 people and can reduce pollution loads by 16.35 tonnes of BOD/year, as well as greenhouse gas emissions of around 206.04 tonnes of CO2 eq/year. year.
Facilities developed at this ecotourism include green open space, cafe, foodwaste biodigester, MSME booth, IPAL, rainwater harvester, and indicator pond in the form of a wetland to improve water quality.
From a food waste biodigester with a capacity of 20 kg per day, you can light 5 stove burners for 3 hours.
Meanwhile, the Ecoriparian at UNILAK began construction in 2022, equipped with a 10 hectare Biodiversity Arboretum Park conservation area which also received the MURI Record for the first Sumatran Swamp Forest Biodiversity Park with more than 200 types of flora and fauna.
Facilities developed at this ecotourism include a canteen, amphitheater, jogging track, bridge and other public tourism support facilities.
